Indicator: Years of Potential Life Lost Before Age 75
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Years of Potential Life Lost Before Age 75 (YPLL-75) is an age-adjusted rate per 100,000 of the population. It is based on the average years a person would have lived if he or she had not died before age 75.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.  The methods for calculating premature death have been updated since prior reports.

Indicator: Life Expectancy in Years, Male
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Life expectancy at birth is the expected number of years to be lived by someone born at the time of calculation, if mortality at each age remains constant in the future.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic & Hispanic

Indicator: Life Expectancy in Years, Female
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Life expectancy at birth is the expected number of years to be lived by someone born at the time of calculation, if mortality at each age remains constant in the future.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic & Hispanic

Indicator: Poor or Fair Health
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults who rate their health as "fair" or "poor" in response to the question, "In general, would you say that your health is excellent, very good, good, fair, or poor?"
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Adult Smoking Prevalence
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults who have smoked at least 100 cigarettes in their lifetime and currently smoke "every day" or "some days."
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Teen Smoking Prevalence, 9th-12th Grade
dataSource: Youth Risk Behavior Survey (YRBS)
description: Percentage of 9th-12th grade students who smoked on at least one day in past 30 days.

Indicator: Smoking-Attributable Mortality Rate per 100,000 People
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Age-adjusted rate of deaths attributable to smoking per 100,000 adults 35 years and older. This measure is based on CDC's Smoking-Attributable Mortality, Morbidity, and Economic Costs (SAMMEC) methodology. For more details: https://chronicdata.cdc.gov/Health-Consequences-and-Costs/Smoking-Attributable-Mortality-Morbidity-and-Econo/3kjq-j5dm/data & https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK294316/
Note: Data missing for some race/ethnic subgroups due to small sample size. The methods for calculating smoking-attributable mortality have been updated since prior reports and are not comparable to previous years.

Indicator: Secondhand Smoke Exposure at Home Among Children
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of children under 18 who live with an adult who smokes in the home.
Note: Data missing for some race/ethnic subgroups due to small sample size.

Indicator: Adult Binge Drinking
dataSource: Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS)
description: Adult binge drinking is the percentage of adults reporting binge drinking.
Note: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention define binge drinking as drinking 5 or more drinks on an occasion for men or 4 or more drinks on an occasion for women. Data missing for some race/ethnic subgroups due to small sample size. Please note that data years differ across dimensions for this indicator.

Indicator: Teen Excessive Drinking, 9th-12th Grade
dataSource: Youth Risk Behavior Survey (YRBS)
description: Percentage of 9th-12th grade students who had 5 or more alcoholic drinks in a row within a couple hours on at least one day in past 30 days.

Indicator: Child Obesity Prevalence, Male, 5-18 Years of Age
dataSource: School District of Philadelphia
description: Percentage of male children, age 5 to 18 years, enrolled in the School District of Philadelphia (SDP) with a body mass index (BMI) greater than or equal to the 95th percentile for their age and gender group based on 2000 Centers for Disease Control growth charts. BMI data are based on nurse-measured heights and weights.
Note: Data are by school year.

Indicator: Child Obesity Prevalence, Female, 5-18 Years of Age
dataSource: School District of Philadelphia
description: Percentage of female children, 5 to 18 years, enrolled in the School District of Philadelphia (SDP) with a body mass index (BMI) greater than or equal to the 95th percentile for their age and gender group based on 2000 Centers for Disease Control growth charts. BMI data are based on nurse-measured heights and weights.
Note: Data are by school year.

Indicator: Adult Obesity Prevalence
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults with BMI greater than or equal to 30kg/m2, based on self-reported height and weight.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Adults Drinking ≥ 1 Sugary Drink Daily
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults who drank soda, sweetened fruit drinks, and/or bottled teas at least once a day for past 30 days. Respondents were instructed “do not include diet soda/drinks.”
Note: Examples provided to respondents included Coke, 7-Up, Snapple, Hugs, lemonade, and Kool-Aid. Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Teens Drinking ≥ 1 Soda Daily, 9th-12th Grade
dataSource: Youth Risk Behavior Survey (YRBS)
description: Percentage of 9th-12th grade students who drank soda at least once a day for past 30 days. Respondents were instructed “Do not count diet soda or diet pop.”
Note: Examples provided to respondents included Coke, Pepsi, and Sprite.

Indicator: Adult Hypertension Prevalence
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults who have been told by a doctor or other health professional that they have high blood pressure or hypertension. Excludes respondents with a history of gestational hypertension only.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Adult Diabetes Prevalence
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults who have been told by a doctor or other health professional that they have or have had diabetes. Excludes respondents with a history of gestational diabetes only.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: New HIV Diagnoses per 100,000 People
dataSource: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Rate of new HIV diagnoses per 100,000 of the population.

Indicator: New HIV Diagnoses from Male-to-Male Sexual Contact
dataSource: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of new HIV diagnoses from male-to-male sexual contact.

Indicator: New HIV Diagnoses from Heterosexual Contact
dataSource: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of new HIV diagnoses from heterosexual contact.

Indicator: New HIV Diagnoses from Injection Drug Use
dataSource: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of new HIV diagnoses from injection drug use.

Indicator: Retention in HIV/AIDS Care
dataSource: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of persons living with diagnosed HIV having had 2 or more CD4 or viral load test results, at least 3 months apart, during a 12 month period.

Indicator: Viral Suppression
dataSource: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of persons diagnosed living with HIV, who were alive at year end and had a viral load < 200 at most recent test. Persons diagnosed living with HIV whose viral load was not assessed were considered unsuppressed.

Indicator: Adults Never Tested for HIV, 18-39 Years of Age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults, age 18-39 years, reporting "never" to the question, "The next question is about the test for HIV, the virus that causes AIDS. About how long has it been since you last had a test for HIV? Would you say one year or less, more than one year, up to two years, more than 2 years, or never?"
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Teens Who are Currently Sexually Active, 9th-12th Grade
dataSource: Youth Risk Behavior Survey (YRBS)
description: Percentage of 9th-12th grade students who reported having had sexual intercourse during the past 3 months.

Indicator: Teens Who Used a Condom with Last Sexual Encounter, 9th-12th Grade
dataSource: Youth Risk Behavior Survey (YRBS)
description: Percentage of sexually active 9th-12th grade students who reported using a condom during their most recent sexual intercourse. Respondents are considered sexually active if they report intercourse with at least one person in the three months preceding the survey.
Note: Data missing for some race/ethnic subgroups due to small sample size.

Indicator: Teens Who Used Birth Control with Last Sexual Encounter, 9th-12th Grade
dataSource: Youth Risk Behavior Survey (YRBS)
description: Percentage of sexually active 9th-12th grade students who used some form of birth control during the most recent sexual intercourse. Respondents are considered sexually active if they report intercourse with at least one person in the three months preceding the survey.
Note: Data missing for some race/ethnic subgroups due to small sample size.

Indicator: Teen Births per 1,000 Teens, 15-19 Years of Age
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Birth rate per 1,000 teen girls age 15-19 years.
Note: Data missing for some race/ethnic subgroups due to small sample size. Caution low sample size: White, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Infant Mortality Rate per 1,000 Live Births
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Mortality rate per 1,000 live-born infants under one year of age.
Note: Three years of data were combined to provide more reliable estimates by race/ethnicity, therefore these numbers are not directly comparable with previous estimates. Data missing for some race/ethnic subgroups due to small sample size.

Indicator: Low Birth Weight Births
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Percentage of live-born infants weighing less than 2,500 grams - or 5 pounds 8 ounces - at birth.
Note: The methods for calculating low birth weights have been updated since prior reports.

Indicator: Late or No Prenatal Care
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Percentage of women who received prenatal care either in the third trimester or not at all, out of all women giving birth within the year, for whom the timing of prenatal care is known.

Indicator: Breastfeeding Initiation
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Percentage of women initiating breastfeeding before hospital discharge, out of all women for whom breastfeeding status is known.
Note: The methods for calculating breastfeeding initiation have been updated since prior reports.

Indicator: Children Up to Date on Immunizations, 19-35 Months of Age
dataSource: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of children, age 19-35 months, who have completed the recommended vaccination schedule 4:3:1:3 (DTaP : IPV : MMR : Hib).

Indicator: Asthma Hospitalization Rate per 10,000 Children, <18 Years of Age
dataSource: Pennsylvania Health Care Cost Containment Council
description: Age-adjusted rate of hospital discharges with a primary diagnosis of asthma per 100,000 children under 18.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic. The methods for calculating asthma hospitalization have been updated since prior reports and are not comparable to previous years.

Indicator: Adults Without Insurance, 18-64 Years of Age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults, age 18-64 years, reporting no source of insurance.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Children Without Insurance, <18 Years of Age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of children under 18 for whom no source of insurance is reported by adult proxy.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Adults Covered by Medicaid, 18-64 Years of Age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults, age 18-64 years, reporting insurance coverage through Medicaid, Medical Assistance (M.A.), HealthChoices, or Access Card.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Adults Forgoing Care Due to Cost, 18-64 Years of Age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults, age 18-64 years, answering "yes" to the question, "In the past year, has there been any time when you were sick or injured AND did not seek health care because of the cost?"
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Children with Dental Visit in Past Year, 3-17 Years of Age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of children, age 3-17 years, for whom adult proxy reported dental visit in past 12 months.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Cancer Mortality per 100,000 People
dataSource: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
description: Age-adjusted rate of cancer deaths per 100,000 persons.
Note: Data missing for some race/ethnic subgroups due to small sample size.

Indicator: Adults with Colonoscopy or Sigmoidoscopy in Lifetime, 50-74 Years of Age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults, age 50-74 years, reporting ever having had a colonoscopy or sigmoidoscopy.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Women with Mammography in Past 2 Years, 50-74 Years of Age
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of women, age 50-74 years, reporting having had a mammogram in the past 2 years.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Girls Completing 3-dose HPV Vaccine, 13-17 Years of Age
dataSource: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Percentage of girls, age 13-17 years, who received 3 doses of HPV vaccine out of all girls 13-17 years in the population.
Note: Data are based on local reporting of immunizations provided by clinicians, and some underreporting for adolescents may occur.

Indicator: Homicide Mortality Rate per 100,000 People
dataSource: Medical Examiner's Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Rate of homicide deaths per 100,000 persons.

Indicator: Firearm Homicide Rate per 100,000 People
dataSource: Medical Examiner's Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Rate of intentional deaths by discharge of firearm per 100,000 persons.

Indicator: Teens Considering Suicide in Past Year, 9th-12th grade
dataSource: Youth Risk Behavior Survey (YRBS)
description: Percentage of 9th-12th grade students who seriously considered attempting suicide in past 12 months.

Indicator: Adults with Diagnosed Mental Health Condition
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults answering "yes" to the question, "Have you ever been diagnosed with any mental health condition, including clinical depression, anxiety disorder or bipolar disorder?"
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Opioid-Related Mortality Rate per 100,000 People
dataSource: Medical Examiner's Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
description: Rate of deaths per 100,000 persons that were determined by the medical examiner to be caused by drug/medication overdose and for which a toxicology test was positive for an opioid.
Note: Opioids include heroin, morphine, methadone, and all prescriptions opioids such as codeine, hydrocodone, and oxycodone.

Indicator: Limited Access to Healthy Foods
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults reporting that it is “difficult” or “very difficult” to find fruit and vegetables in their neighborhood.
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic. Please note that data definitions and sources differ across dimensions for this indicator.

Indicator: Access to nearby parks or outdoor space
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults responding yes to the question, “Is there a park or other outdoor space in your neighborhood that you’re comfortable visiting during the day?”
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.

Indicator: Advanced or Proficient English Language Arts (ELA) Achievemet in 3rd Grade
dataSource: School District of Philadelphia
description: Percentage of 3rd graders who score at the advanced or proficient levels as assessed by the Pennsylvania System of School Assessment (PSSA) standardized test.
Note: Data are by school year.

Indicator: On-Time High School Graduation, Females
dataSource: School District of Philadelphia as reported by The Notebook
description: Percentage of all students who graduate from high school within four years after starting 9th grade.
Note: Data are by school year.

Indicator: On-Time High School Graduation, Males
dataSource: School District of Philadelphia as reported by The Notebook
description: Percentage of all students who graduate from high school within four years after starting 9th grade.
Note: Data are by school year.

Indicator: Adults Completing Some College, ≥ 25 Years of Age
dataSource: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 1-year estimates
description: Percentage of adults, 25 years or older, who completed at least some college.
Note: Please note that data years differ across dimensions for this indicator.

Indicator: Unemployment, ≥ 16 Years of Age
dataSource: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 1-year estimates
description: Percentage of population, 16 years or older, who are unemployed but seeking work.
Note: Please note that data sources and years differ across dimensions for this indicator.

Indicator: Philadelphians Living in Poverty
dataSource: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 1-year estimates
description: Percentage of population with an income below 100% of the federal poverty level (FPL).
Note: In 2015, the FPL was equivalent to a yearly income of no more than $11,770 for an individual, or $24,250 for a family of 4. Please note that data years differ across dimensions for this indicator.

Indicator: Children Living in Poverty, < 18 Years of Age
dataSource: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 1-year estimates
description: Percentage of children under 18 with a family income below 100% of the federal poverty level (FPL).
Note: In 2015, the FPL was equivalent to a yearly income of no more than $11,770 for an individual, or $24,250 for a family of 4. Please note that data years differ across dimensions for this indicator.

Indicator: Social Capital
dataSource: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
description: Percentage of adults reporting "yes" to, "Have people in your neighborhood ever worked together to improve the neighborhood? For example, through a neighborhood watch, creating a community garden, building a community playground, or participating in a block party."
Note: Caution low sample size: Asian, non-Hispanic.
